doc.title: Midea 1H25: B2B strength, strong domestic offset by export weakness
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/Midea 1H25 B2B strength strong domestic offset by export weaknessMidea 1H25 B2B strength strong domestic offset by expor_2025-08-30

passages.text: **Midea Group Co Ltd**

**Midea delivered solid 1H25 performance with revenue and earnings growth of 15.7%** **and 25% YoY respectively,** though momentum slowed in 2Q25 with revenue growing 11% and net profit up 15% YoY. The company's ToB business continues to outperform at +16.6%,while domestic consumer sales remained resilient at +15%. However, overseas performance was weak with low-single-digit growth, impacted by macroeconomic headwinds and potential US tariff effects in 2H. Across segments, Building Solutions grew impressively at 25% (Domestic +25%, Overseas +35%), while Industrial segments rose 15%, and traditional consumer categories showed mixed results with refrigerators & washing machines up 10%.

**Management acknowledged gross margin pressure but highlighted operational** **efficiency improvements that supported net profit margin.** The company is prioritizing market share over margins in the near term and will respond aggressively to price wars if necessary. Management remains confident that efficiency initiatives (targeting 0.8% NPM improvement) will support earnings growth exceeding revenue growth for FY25. Financial income contributed positively to margin improvement in Q2, with favorable exchange rate impacts expected to continue.

**For FY25, Midea maintains its revenue guidance of high-single-digit to low-double-** **digit revenue growth but indicated that earnings growth should be faster, up from the** **previous guide of stable net profit margin,** though management cautioned that 1Q was likely the strongest quarter of the year, with 2H expected to be weaker than 1H. Overseas business showed signs of recovery in July/August, though OEM remains weak while OBM shows strength. The company announced its first dividend, reflecting confidence in cash flow generation. [continued to next page]
Source: Bloomberg, Bernstein estimates and analysis.

First Published: 29 Aug 2025 20:32 UTC Completion Date: 29 Aug 2025 16:49 UTC
[continued from front page]

While Midea's domestic business demonstrates resilience, we see increasing headwinds from overseas markets and potential margin pressure. The company's focus on market share may lead to intensified competition in key segments. Looking ahead to 2026, management remains cautious but pointed to potential consumption stimulus policies and indicated mid- to- high single digit revenue growth in coming years, with ToB segments potentially playing a balancing role against consumer market volatility.

Midea continues to demonstrate resilience by offsetting weaker export performance with robust growth in its B2B segment. Management's focus on expanding market share, supported by ongoing efficiency initiatives and organizational restructuring, positions Midea to navigate a competitive landscape. Although the combination of slowing growth and margin pressures presents some near- term headwinds, Midea's diversified business model enhances its ability to adapt and maintain stability. This strategic approach supports the company's long- term outlook, even as it works through current market challenges. However, in the near- term, the domestic ToC market faces challenges — particularly as the impact of national subsidies fades starting in the fourth quarter.

The company continues its organizational restructuring, including the appointment of a new Executive President and consolidation of washing machine and cleaning businesses. The transformation remains a core strategy, with improvements in supply chain efficiency and retail terminal data acquisition. Management emphasized inventory optimization with movement to cloud warehouses and enhanced user data collection at retail touchpoints.
EXHIBIT 1: Midea 1H25 earnings results

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, L.P. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.

We value Midea on target next- twelve- month price- to- earnings (NTM P/E) multiples. We select the target NTM P/E based on company's profit growth and return on invested capital (ROIC). We believe that stocks with higher long- term growth rates and higher ROIC deserve higher multiples and so we apply incremental company premiums or discounts to individual stocks to reflect their outlook for growth and returns.
Our target price for Midea is RMB76/HKD78 based on 12x/11.5x NTM+1 P/E
+ AC volume sales and ASP growth better than expected + Gross margins improvement better than expected

+ AC volume sales and ASP growth worse than expected + Gross margins improvement worse than expected + Supply chain disruption resolved later than expected + Investments in other projects such as robots, new energy vehicle parts become margin dilutive + Expansion of overseas business grow slower than expected

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:
- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp
- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI) index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non- Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp- Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp- Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12- month time horizon.
